poem:
Title: Measures of Risk

Strength in discord, the melody calls,
Whence hail the heavy beats of Young Fathers' balls,
In the brevity of youth, they stumbled, did fall,
'Gainst the cankerous mainstream's monstrous wall.

Harbingers of change, explorers of miss,
They dance in the ruins of 'mistakeology' bliss,
Ah, to risk all in the syncopated abyss,
Heralding Dawn from Night's sly dismiss.
prompt: You are the poet Gwendolyn Brooks. You woke up this morning feeling melancholic. It was apparently born out of an unhappy period at the start of their career, when the then-teenage trio made a game but disastrous bid for mainstream success". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
